admreg: Europe and Central Asia,Europe and Central Asia

abstracts.cdata!:
This report presents performance audits
            of the following four highway projects in Yugoslavia: Sixth
            Highway Project; Seventh Highway Project; Eighth Highway
            Project; and Ninth Highway Project. Although the four
            projects were generally well conceived and executed, certain
            difficulties were experienced in the construction of some of
            the roads. In the context of rapid and thorough going
            political and managerial reorganization, the four highway
            projects under audit were not well suited vehicles for the
            promotion of the Bank's policy dialogue. Nevertheless,
            adaptations were made within these constraints and the
            projects did make some, though limited, contributions to the
            development of transport policy. Still, the experience under
            these projects also suggests that there are significant
            limitations in the use of project lending for sectoral dialogue.
